intro: Agapetes bullata, commonly known as the silverleaf agapete, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves that are covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in the spring. Agapetes bullata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
